runs.comm: hint of away swing for Watson as the batsman drives on the up to cover.
137kph, beaten this time! Appreciable movement away from Smith's lashing bat as he looks to smoke the full length ball through the covers
Smith's tangle against outswing continues. Though the length is pulled back, the hint of movement deceives him again
fullish on middle and off, defended sedately
dribbles off the pad towards fine leg as Watson goes for the inswinger.
another one that looks to cramp him on middle and leg stump. Smith's intended flick goes off the pad towards square leg
what a ripper! Angles it in on a full length and it shapes away after pitching. Squares Gayle up completely and I cannot believe that missed the edge, or off stump for that matter
fullish on off stump and this time Gayle gets a straight bat down on the ball. More away swing for Starc
caressed through the covers, you heard that right. Quite full and just outside off, Gayle inched forward and times this almost perfectly
thumped straight down the ground! It length and once he got under it, the ball disappears. One-bounce to long-off
one-bounce to midwicket this time! Starc refuses him room but Gayle has picked this from off stump and deposited it to that short boundary
skips down the track and though the length is pulled back, he flat-bats it to the long-off boundary. One of our feedbackers was asking for Gayle to wake up, guess he has
136 kph, good length ball angled across him, Smith slaps to cover
pulled away! This was shortish on off stump and he was set up on the back foot. Rolled his wrists and kept it down.
inside edge as he goes for another pull. Gets the inside edge and Haddin's dive to his right isn't good enough
another short ball, this one getting considerable bounce. Whacks him on the helmet as he goes for another pull and skies towards third man
keeps it nice and tight on off stump and Gayle prefers to defend

backs away to leg and he's clipped it over square leg! Flat, hard and hello short boundary! Bollinger did well to try and follow him but it almost seemed like that was what Gayle wanted. Kept his front leg out of the way and swung it to the left of the deep fielder
tossed up on off stump, dug out to mid-off
muscled it to the long-off boundary. The fielder inside the circle tries his best, employing a full length dive to his right but it was struck so sweetly
flighted on middle and he's smashed to long-on. Reaches on the bounce and with considerable heat
picks it up from just outside off and slams this to the deep midwicket boundary. Faulkner is the man in the deep and despite his dive, he can't stop it

that's a chance and it's Haddin who's the culprit again. Maxi bowls it full and fast just outside off. Gayle's late in blocking it and loses his balance. Had the keeper collected it cleanly, Gayle would have been out stumped
sweeps to the square leg boundary. Sheer power from Gayle as he picks it off a length and pounds it away
shortish and pushed across Smith, goes for a cut but to no avail

struck too hard for Bailey to hold on at mid-on! This was full on middle and Smith has thumped this to the right of the Aussie captain and the ball races past him before he can cup his hands around it
fullish and wide outside off, Smith who was already clearing his front leg, can't do much more than bunt it into the covers
slower ball outisde off, Smith was on one knee looking to slash through the covers and can't reach
just back of a good length on off stump keeps Smith quiet

there's the first one! Haddin holds onto a regulation take and Smith has to walk back! Wouldn't have looked out of place in a Test, with Starc probing outside his off stump. Goes for an on the up drive but only succeeds in nicking off. Is that the opening Australia needed?
fullish on middle and leg, Gayle squeezes this behind square leg for a couple
skips down the track, but he's mistimed the loft over extra. Pulls up inside the boundary for a couple
smack! This time over long-on, and only just over too. Flat six. Makes room on the leg side and swings clean
pushed full and well wide of off stump, Gayle was moving leg side again and doesn't bother trying to reach it
another little foray down the track, but the carve over extra doesn't materialise. Watson does extremely well to push the ball wide of off stump, but yet keep it inside the wide line
shortish ball on leg stump, dabbed away behind square leg
strays on the pads and Gayle flicks to deep square leg
slices this through a diving point. Full and just enough room for his angled bat to fetch a single
back of the hand slower ball, but the direction is off. Slides down leg
this time he digs the slower ball in short and Gayle works it off his waist towards square leg
oh, gorgeous stroke! This was a good length ball angled across him and Simmons strides forward and punches through extra cover
pushed down to mid-off and he urges Gayle through for the single. The throw comes in at Simmons' end and he was well safe
another slower ball gone awry, goes down the leg side again
short of a good length as he sticks to a middle and leg line, Gayle works it to deep square leg
fullish and just outside off, pushed into the covers off the back foot
back of a length and just outside off, Gayle was looking to belt it through midwicket but adjusts and hacks it down to long-off
full and just outside off, driven to mid-on
strays down the leg side and Simmons happily clips it to the long leg boundary. Slower ball gone wrong again, I think
shortish on middle, he rocks back and pulls to deep square leg
digs it into the middle of the pitch and forces Gayle to take evasive action. Excellent ball, and he made it follow Gayle as well
good length ball on off stump, Simmons presents a straight bat
opens the face, but he can't find the gap through the covers. Nice tight line just outside off
fullish and around the off stump, Simmons tries his luck through midwicket. No dice
goes down the track and he has slammed this. But Warner is at mid-off, throws himself to his left and stops a certain boundary
shortish and just outside off, Gayle blocks
fullish and angled in at him, Gayle nudges to long-on and jogs for the single
tossed up just outside off, Gayle was setting himself up for a launch over midwicket, but then corrects himself. The line was too far outside off for that
thick outside lobs in the region of short third man, but falls short. Maxi's flight is working for him
good-looking drive through the covers fetches a couple. Excellent placement, right between long-off and deep cover
shorter ball with ample room, Gayle rocks back and the cut finds the man in the deep
big backlift swings down clean on the ball as he finds the gap wide of long-on. Little shimmy down the track to reach the pitch and he's smoked it with the turn
laps it from middle and off for a couple past short fine leg. Premeditated stroke and the bowler offers the perfect length to pull that shot off
flighted just outside off and Gayle comes forward to defend
there's his fifty as he hits this tossed up delivery on middle to deep square leg. Sedately run couple
launches into a cover drive as this was enticingly tossed up outside off. Picks out cover
flatter ball pushes him back in his crease and Gayle bunts this down to long-on
loopy full toss outside off and it beats both batsman and keeper. Should really have smashed that through extra cover, which was what he was trying to do.
flighted and drifting in on leg, Simmons is forward and clips to deep midwicket
bisects long leg and deep square leg with a sweep from leg stump. Great timing and placement from the West Indies No.3
this time goes for the lap sweep as the bowler appeals for a leg before. The should have pitched outside leg stump. Couple taken as the ball dribbles away past the keeper and short fine leg
comes forward to the flighted ball outside off and blocks well

this was the leggie from Maxwell and Simmons goes for the cut and misses. Haddin waits for the batsman to lose balance, but by the time he clips the bails Simmons has plonked his back foot back down inside his crease
comes down the track and works it off to deep midwicket to bring up the fifty partnership
stays back and punches this to long-off. Warner makes Gayle hurry into the crease with a stinging throw back to the bowler

so much for not bowling the legspinner against Gayle! This was the googly, he comes down the track, perhaps a little too much, and drills this straight into the hands of Maxwell at deep midwicket. Collects the catch coolly and then erupts in celebration, just as Bravo did when he caught Maxi in the same position in the first innings
ripping leg spinner and Samuels is beaten all ends up. Now we know why Warnie's backing him
flighted on off stump and he waits for it a little better than the last one and drills it to short cover
that's the skidder and Samuels was almost fooled. Went back and punched to short cover
this was a rank long-hop and Samuels' trouble while starting his innings is clear as he pulls to long-on. This came right off the bottom of hte bat
comes down the track and whips to deep midwicket
fullish and angled across him, Simmons punches it down to mid-off
clears his front leg and his lash has cleared Bailey at mid-off. Chases after it and flicks it back for Warner who was haring in from long-on to mop up
good length ball on off stump, Simmons looks to smash it over long-on but mistimes the stroke.
142kph, tucks him up on leg stump and Samuels suggests he got a little inside edge onto pad. But the ump disagrees, single towards point

Maxi, you beauty! Snaffles an important grab right on the deep square leg boundary! Goes for the pull as he sees the ball short and with enough room to free his arms. Struck it rather well, but the fielder had positioned himself perfectly, leapt up to intercept the ball from going for six
back of a length on and around off stump, as Bravo dabs towards point
flighted on middle, and drifts in too. Bravo uses it to flick wide of long-on
persist with tossing the ball up and he whips it away to deep square leg
low full toss with ample room outside off. Samuels has clubbed it seeking the long-on boundary and gets it as Mitchell Starc's parry back doesn't quite succeed
flighted on middle and leg, whipped away to long-on again
this has been dismissed over square leg! Muirhead offers up a waist-high full toss and it's been thumped away. 67m six over the short boundary
shortish and it rips a bit outside off, the batsman slaps it to the man on the cover boundary
shortish and directed at the body, Bravo works it behind square leg
refuses to offer it up in the batsman's half of the pitch. Another short ball on and around off stump. Samuels looks for the pull and mistimes it so badly it goes back to the bowler
132kph, excellent short ball again. Samuels goes for the pull and misses completely. Too high for him
good length ball on and around off stump, dabbed behind point
shortish on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket. Played with soft hands, but it's not enough for the two he wants
pulled to deep midwicket for only the fourth run of the over. Another short ball with a hint of room outside off.
clears his front leg and goes for an almighty slog. Results in a top edge that clears a back-pedalling Haddin
slower ball pushed through full on off stump, clears his front leg and smokes it wide of long-off but Warner's up for the challenge.

another slower ball and Haddin flings to his right and pulls off a stunner! Samuels seemed to have nothing in his kitty except making room on leg stump and swinging wildly. This time the lack in pace deceives him as he gets a thick edge through to the keeper, who did spectacularly well to dive and hold on
fullish and just outside off, Sammy the new batsman, pushes to long-off
pulls all his pace off the ball as this is full on off stump. Drilled to extra cover where Hodge stops it
oh dear, he's offered up length and Bravo's tucked into it. Went back and pulled it into the stands behind deep square leg
145kph, terrific yorker on middle stump and Sammy jams his bat down on it. Strikes it well enough to find long-off
Bravo was making loads of room outside leg and he follows him. Sends down another brilliant yorker that sneaks through his bat and pad

that's a Bravo special! This time the length is there for him to get under and he smears this over extra cover. Faulker at the deep runs to his right and pulls out a desperate right hand to pull it back, but he just has too much to do
finds the blockhole again and his line is excellent. Bravo was making room and he refused to give him that luxury
full and straight, Sammy whips it away to deep square leg
142kph, he's double bluffed him! Sought to move outside leg but then moved back in front of his stumps to flick a low full toss on his pads to the fine leg boundary.
he's launched that over long-on! Overpitched delivery outside off stump, and Sammy was waiting deep in his crease and he's walloped it. That big bat swing is so West Indian

low full toss wide of off stump, Sammy's made a bit of room and he's slashed it to the man at deep point. Flat and hard throw makes Sammy struggle to make is ground but his dive is just about enough. Maxi was the fielder down there

what a shot! I honestly can't describe that to the clarity it deserves. It was fullish on off stump and Sammy bends his knees and sort of whipped it away past deep square leg. Walks across to punch gloves to his partner with a great big smile on his face.
outside edge races off towards the third man boundary until James Muirhead pulls of a diving effort. You need those in the death overs
full and wide outside off and Sammy's lashed this behind point. Sammy's shaking things up!
low full toss outisde off, thumped to long-on and Sammy keeps the strike. 19 off this over. 12 needed off the final one
full on leg stump and Sammy was surprised by it. Doesn't offer a shot as he pads it away towards fine leg. Talk about bamboozling the batsman!
another dot ball! This was a yorker on middle and Sammy can only dig it out back to the bowler. Bailey applauds and so do the Australian contingent
full toss and it has room for Sammy to pummel it just over long-off. Cleared his front leg and secures a vital hit for West Indies. Chris Gayle pulls out a mini-chainsaw!

it's all over! Straight six to seal the game and West Indies invade the field! Goes full and straight but Sammy bludgeons it down the ground! Gayle is going beserk! I've never seen him lose his cool like this. He was toppled over by his team-mates on the way to rushing out, but once he's back up he breaks out the gangnam.
